text: ANeurisma (stylized: aN) was a Chilean metalcore band from Santiago, Metropolitan Region formed in 2001. ==History== ===Early and Síntomas and Renacer (2001–2007)=== The band was formed on September 25, 2001, with Max Rodriguez, Felipe Alvarez, Diego Izquierdo and Francisco Izquierdo. These four members who did not exceed fifteen; proposed form something simple, but full. Shortly after the band created their first self-titled demo, and thanks to this were presented Aggrofest and Underfest Festival. In 2006, guitarist Felipe Alvarez left the band to pursue new opportunities. Later he joined Cristian Guzmán and the band released their second EP, "Renacer". Frank Millard (former member of Rosewell) as rhythm guitarist joined the band, but before recordings, Cristian Guzman left the band for personal reasons. ===Camino de Reflexiones (2007–2008)=== Between 2007 and 2008, the band focused on the composition of his new album along with the entry of the band Alexis Ruiz, occupying the post of lead guitarist Felipe Alvarez. The album recorded in the second half of 2008. At the end of the year, Pablo Salinas is integrated as rhythm guitarist. His second album, "Camino de Reflexiones" was released in late 2008. ===Ciclos and break-up (2012–2014)=== In 2012 the members of the band had announced via Facebook recording a third album and would be released in the first half of 2013. Finally, on September 16 of that year, the band released their third album, "Ciclos".
